description: For each y >= 1 there are only finitely many values of x >= 1 such that x-y and x+y are both squares; list all such pairs (x,y) ordered by values of y; sequence gives x values.
references: Donald D. Spencer, Computers in Number Theory, Computer Science Press, Rockville MD, 1982, pp. 130-131.
formula: The solutions are given by x = r^2+2*r*k+2*k^2, y = 2*k*(k+r) with r >= 1, k >= 1. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 02 2001
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), May 01 2001
